com.taursys.servlet
Class ServletInputDispatcher

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.taursys.xml.event.Dispatcher
        |
        +--com.taursys.servlet.ServletInputDispatcher
Deprecated. ServletForm now uses the inherited InputDispatcher. This class is no longer used and will be removed in a future release.

public class ServletInputDispatcher
extends Dispatcher

Subcomponent responsible for receiving and dispatching servlet InputEvents. Components should registered with this Dispatcher via their parent Container to be notified whenever their input arrives.

This subcomponent will dispatch any input present in the ServletRequest to registered Components.

Only Components which subclass Parameter are allowed to use this Dispatcher.

Method Detail

dispatchToComponent

public void dispatchToComponent(Component c)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. 

Dispatches an InputEvent to the given component. If the given Component is a DocumentElement, an InputEvent with a null value and name is dispatched. If the given Component is a Parameter then normal dispatching occurs (see following). If the given Component is neither of the above two types, then no dispatching occurs.

The components will only be dispatched its own input as specified by its parameter property. If the component's parameter is present, then the event will contain that value. If the parameter is NOT present, AND the component's defaultValue is set, then the event will contain the defaultValue. If the parameter is NOT present and defaultValue is NULL, no event will be dispatched.

Specified by:
dispatchToComponent in class Dispatcher
Parameters:
c - the Component to dispatch the event to.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - from the components dispatchEvent method if occurs.

dispatch

public void dispatch(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. 
Dispatches a InputEvent to each registered component. Components will only be dispatched their own input as specified by their parameter property. If the component's parameter is present, then the event will contain that value. If the parameter is NOT present, AND the component's defaultValue is set, then the event will contain the defaultValue. If the parameter is NOT present and defaultValue is NULL, no event will be dispatched.

Parameters:
request - the ServletRequest containing the input parameters
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - from the components dispatchEvent method if occurs.
